Just WOW and WOW!! what a short and great game! the closure of the game and their expansions, I just loved it with all the words included.

What can I say about it? Everything, I really loved and enjoyed more the storyline on this expansion than Opposing Forces to be honest and filled with much better situations like the elevator one OMG I was so thrilled when it happened!!! and had much to do with Freeman's whereabouts and constant epic moments.

Can you believe that you go to work and the worst or best? things happened to you that day!? Will you ever tell it to your friends or family when they ask you: 

Hey how was your day at work? 

And you, just reply... pretty normal as always hahaha 

It's just hilarious!!! just think about that situation and that's why I really liked it the most of the time and was pretty funny to be honest lol because this kind of things could happen to us any time (except with the alien invasion of course lol).

Let's back to the bussiness. Difficulty was the same as the other two games, pretty good and balanced. The weapons are very similar to Half-Life missing a few but was ok. 

The storyline was just perfect as I said, sadly is too short but so great! 

I recommend it and right now is my favorite expansion of the game. Tons of fun and thrilling moments!

Half-Life: Blue Shift was a fantastic game! This time you play a Black Mesa security guard, that has to fight for survival once things turn nasty! Followed on from the main game perfectly and it was great to see the game played out from a different perspective, whilst still tying in with the story from the original game. Although the 2 DLC's were released at different dates, it doesn't matter what order you play them in, as they all have a story of their own, but still fits in with what happened in the base game. It was shorter and easier than the other 2 Half-Life games, but it was just as entertaining on all levels. 9/10

Another Valve masterpiece. This time tho, you play as a security guard stuck in this massive mess Prof Freeman in the Black Mesa facility.

It took 3 tries but it's good to know someone made it out of Black Mesa scot-free, hahaha.

In all other respects, this expansion was just more of the same, no new guns, no new enemies, just a different perspective on the events of Half-Life 1.

It makes sense that Calhoun wouldn't be fighting massive numbers of aliens, marines, and black ops. He's just a security guard, plus he has no fancy HEV suit.

It's a pretty simple little game, I think it's shorter than both the original Half-Life and the Military one, who's name escapes me. Short, with no new weapons or cool tweaks, and the only upside being a nice ending. However, there are some absolute arses of puzzles in this particular edition, and combining that with it being pretty short makes for a slightly dissapointing experience. It's not bad, it's just not amazing

I just replayed Blue SHift in honor of its 16 year anniversary. it has its ups and downs, but its all in all a very fun, quick little expansion to the HL universe.

for the time it was made, gameplay is awesome, with almost no glitches. (3 total. 1, sometimes in order to reload you have to shot, change weapons or reload. 2, one time my crowbar wouldnt stop swinging unless i changed weapons. and 3, once i followed a scientist instead of doing what he told me to do. i got stuck and couldnt move, so i had to reload)

the "puzzles" are decent, challenging(but not too much). flow of plotline is good. it makes you realize just how many heroes there really were that day, not just Freeman(while most others didnt have to face as much as him), and if Barney Calhoun wasnt there, the future of the HL universe would be uncertain.
on that note, the plot is short.  not sure how to expand it much, but a bit more could have been nice.

the reason it only gets 9.5/10 is because if the annoyance of the reload glitch, and the fact of how short it is.

Второе дополнение к Half-Life, повествующее о событиях от лица Барни Калхуна - офицера охраны исследовательского комплекса "Чёрная Меза".
Что примечательно - при внимательной игре можно часто заметить Гордона Фримена в тех местах, в которых вы наблюдали события от его лица во время игры в оригинальный Half-Life.
Играя в это чудесное дополнение, можно узнать ещё одну историю человека, который попал в непредвиденные никем обстоятельства, и благодаря своей тяге к жизни спасся и сбежал из Чёрной Мезы.
Это самое короткое дополнение и его вполне играючи можно пройти за 3-4 часа, но при этом не менее ныщенное историей, чем остальные игры серии.
Рекомендуется пройти для ознакомления поближе с персонажем Бархи Калхуна и наблюдения за тем, как простой офицер охраны в бешенстве может раскидывать десятки военных, попутно постреливая в танки и бронетранспортёры.

Biggest complaint, out of the way right now, is just how stupidly short this is. I finishedmy first playthrough of this game in 3.7 hours, and this is even with quite a few deaths (mainly resulting from platforming or other such nonsense). The content is good, but the pacing goes in such a way that you can feel just how short this game is. I thought I was getting halfway through it when I was suddenly at the end right after finding the Doctor NPC who you need to find locked in a train car. However, for how short it is, it's still solid and didn't drag on for longer than it needed to. The devs had an idea in mind and only made it as long as needed, which I can respect. That DOES make it, however, the shortest of all three original Half-Life games, but does tht make it bad? No, I don't think so. It just comes as a surprise. I would say, if you liked the original Half-Life, then play this one out of respect for th franchise, if nothing else. It's still good on it's own, just feels like it was meant to be treated as a story expansion rather than it's own full length game. Get it with the bundle that comes with it, Opposing Force, Half-Life, and TF:C for the best deal, though.

Half-Life: Blue Shift is the second expansion episode for Half Life 1. Similarly to Half Life: Opposing Force, the story occurs parallel to the original Half Life. The player takes control of a new character, Barney Calhoun, a security guard. The same Barney that you meet again in Half Life 2.

This episode is very bare bones compared to the original game and the first expansion. It has less weapons than both previous entries, and can be beaten in 2.5 hours if you're good. The story is not quite as interesting as before, but it has its moments. The game is still Half Life, though; all the things that make the original good, such as great gunplay, are still here.

If you're a casual fan of the series then you don't need to play this, but if you really enjoy the series then I would definitely recommend it.
